dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 1219 EH: Supporting America’s Innovators Act of 2017
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.official-title: To amend the Investment Company Act of 1940 to expand the investor limitation for qualifying venture capital funds under an exemption from the definition of an investment company.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Supporting America’s Innovators Act of 2017.

section.header: Investor limitation for qualifying venture capital funds
section.text: Section 3(c)(1) of the Investment Company Act of 1940 (15 U.S.C. 80a–3(c)(1)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by inserting (or, in the case of a qualifying venture capital fund, 250 persons) after one hundred persons; and
by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: The term qualifying venture capital fund means a venture capital fund that has not more than $10,000,000 in aggregate capital contributions and uncalled committed capital, with such dollar amount to be indexed for inflation once every 5 years by the Commission, beginning from a measurement made by the Commission on a date selected by the Commission, rounded to the nearest $1,000,000.
The term venture capital fund has the meaning given the term in section 275.203(l)–1 of title 17, Code of Federal Regulations, or any successor regulation.

attestation-group.attestation-date: Passed the House of Representatives April 6, 2017.
